title: Saudi Business Launchpad marketing website + lead capture form

requirements.text: Create a responsive marketing website for “Saudi Business Launchpad” with top-level navigation and routes/pages for: Home, Services, How It Works, Pricing, Resources, Mentorship & Networking, About Us, and Contact / Get Started. All user-facing text must be in English.

quotes:
Key Pages to Include
1. Home Page
...
8. Contact / Get Started
Simple signup form
WhatsApp / Email contact

acceptanceCriteria: A persistent header navigation links to all 8 pages and works on mobile (hamburger menu) and desktop.
Each page renders distinct content sections aligned to the requested structure.
The site is mobile-first and responsive across common breakpoints.

requirements.text: Implement the Home page content with: headline “Start & Manage Your Business Legally in Saudi Arabia”, a short value proposition (including the provided durable hero text), primary CTAs “Get Started” and “Register Your Business”, and trust indicators emphasizing Saudi-focused, compliant, expert-backed positioning.

quotes:
Home Page
Clear headline: “Start & Manage Your Business Legally in Saudi Arabia”
Short value proposition
Call-to-action buttons: “Get Started”, “Register Your Business”
Trust indicators (Saudi-focused, compliant, expert-backed)

After generation, edit hero text manually to include:
“All-in-one platform for starting and managing businesses in Saudi Arabia — legally, confidently, and faster.”

acceptanceCriteria: Home page shows the exact requested headline text.
Home hero includes the exact durable hero sentence: “All-in-one platform for starting and managing businesses in Saudi Arabia — legally, confidently, and faster.”
Both CTAs are visible above the fold on mobile and desktop and navigate to appropriate pages/sections (e.g., Contact/Get Started and Services or a registration flow teaser).
Trust indicators are displayed in a dedicated section (e.g., icon list or badges) and clearly communicate Saudi-focused, compliant, and expert-backed.

requirements.text: Build the Services page with clear sections/cards for: Business Registration Guidance, Regulatory Compliance Support, Operational Setup Assistance, VAT & ZATCA Compliance, and Licensing & Documentation Support.

quotes:
2. Services
Business Registration Guidance
Regulatory Compliance Support
Operational Setup Assistance
VAT & ZATCA Compliance
Licensing & Documentation Support

acceptanceCriteria: Services page displays exactly the five requested service categories with concise descriptions.
Each service is visually scannable (card/grid or section layout) and responsive.
Each service includes a “Get Started”/“Talk to an Expert” style link that routes to Contact/Get Started.

requirements.text: Build the How It Works page showing a step-by-step flow: Step 1 “Choose Business Type”, Step 2 “Get Guided Registration”, Step 3 “Stay Compliant & Scale”.

quotes:
3. How It Works
Step 1: Choose Business Type
Step 2: Get Guided Registration
Step 3: Stay Compliant & Scale

acceptanceCriteria: How It Works page displays the three steps in order with clear headings matching the requested text.
The steps are presented as a timeline/numbered steps layout that remains readable on mobile.

requirements.text: Build the Pricing page with plan cards for: Free Plan (basic guidance), Pro Subscription (monthly and yearly options), Enterprise Plan, plus a Pay-per-service option section.

quotes:
4. Pricing
Free Plan (basic guidance)
Pro Subscription (monthly/yearly)
Enterprise Plan
Pay-per-service options

acceptanceCriteria: Pricing page shows three primary plan cards (Free, Pro, Enterprise) and a separate pay-per-service section.
Pro plan clearly presents both monthly and yearly options (toggle or side-by-side).
Each plan has a CTA leading to Contact/Get Started.

requirements.text: Build the Resources page with sections for: Business templates, Compliance checklists, Startup guides, and Knowledge base. Content can be presented as downloadable-looking cards/links (static for now).

quotes:
5. Resources
Business templates
Compliance checklists
Startup guides
Knowledge base

acceptanceCriteria: Resources page contains the four requested categories with multiple example items per category (static placeholders are acceptable).
Resource items are displayed in a consistent card/list UI and are responsive.

requirements.text: Build the Mentorship & Networking page with sections describing: access to Saudi business mentors, a startup community, and a partner ecosystem.

quotes:
6. Mentorship & Networking
Access to Saudi business mentors
Startup community
Partner ecosystem

acceptanceCriteria: Mentorship & Networking page includes the three requested sections with clear headings and concise copy.
Each section includes a CTA leading to Contact/Get Started.

requirements.text: Build the About Us page including mission (“Empower Saudi entrepreneurs”), Vision 2030 alignment, and an emphasis on local expertise & partnerships.

quotes:
7. About Us
Mission: Empower Saudi entrepreneurs
Vision aligned with Vision 2030
Local expertise & partnerships

acceptanceCriteria: About page includes the mission statement text “Empower Saudi entrepreneurs”.
About page mentions alignment with Saudi Vision 2030.
About page includes content about local expertise and partnerships.

requirements.text: Build the Contact / Get Started page with a simple signup form that collects at minimum: full name, email, phone (optional), business stage/type (optional), and a message. Include WhatsApp and Email contact options (as links).

quotes:
8. Contact / Get Started
Simple signup form
WhatsApp / Email contact

acceptanceCriteria: Contact page renders a form with required full name + email fields and optional fields as specified.
Form validates required fields client-side and shows success/error states.
WhatsApp and Email contact methods are shown as clickable links (WhatsApp link should be configurable; do not hardcode a real number unless provided).

requirements.text: Implement backend lead capture: store Contact/Get Started submissions in the Motoko canister with timestamp, and expose query methods to list submissions (admin/dev use).

quotes:
Contact / Get Started
Simple signup form

acceptanceCriteria: A backend update method accepts a contact submission payload and persists it to stable storage.
A backend query method returns stored submissions (most recent first or clearly documented order).
Basic input constraints are enforced server-side (e.g., non-empty name and valid-looking email string).

requirements.text: Add basic SEO and trust signals across the site: set per-page document titles/meta descriptions using the provided SEO keywords, and include a footer with consistent branding plus a lightweight disclaimer that content is guidance and not legal advice.

quotes:
SEO Keywords
Saudi business registration, start a business in Saudi Arabia, Saudi compliance platform, business setup KSA, Saudi startup support

Tone & Style
Professional
Trustworthy
Clear & simple

acceptanceCriteria: Each page sets an appropriate title and meta description including relevant keywords where natural.
Site includes a footer with company name and quick links.
A disclaimer is visible in footer or relevant pages stating the platform provides guidance and is not a substitute for professional legal advice.

requirements.text: Apply a consistent visual design system matching the requested preferences: professional/modern, Saudi-friendly palette (green/white with subtle gold accents), clean typography, and trust-focused visuals (business/compliance/growth).

quotes:
Design Preferences
Professional & modern
Saudi-friendly color palette (green, white, subtle gold accents)
Clean typography
Mobile-first design
Trust-focused visuals (business, compliance, growth)

acceptanceCriteria: Primary UI uses a green/white palette with restrained gold accents and high contrast for accessibility.
Typography and spacing are consistent across all pages.
Key sections use trust-focused visual motifs (icons/illustrations) without cluttering the layout.

requirements.text: Generate and integrate required static visual assets (hero illustration + small icon set) into the frontend as static files under frontend/public/assets/generated, and use them in the UI (Home hero and trust/service cards).
acceptanceCriteria: All generated images are stored under frontend/public/assets/generated and referenced directly by the frontend (not via backend).
Home page hero uses the generated hero visual.
Service/trust sections use the generated icons consistently.

constraints: Use English for all user-facing website text.
Do not edit files under frontend/src/components/ui or other immutable paths specified by the platform; compose them instead.
Backend must remain a single Motoko actor (no additional backend services).
Do not implement third-party authentication providers; Internet Identity only if authentication becomes necessary (not required for this build).
nonGoals: Implementing payment processing or subscription billing flows.
Providing real legal advice or guaranteeing compliance outcomes.
Building real-time chat, push notifications, or email/SMS delivery integrations.
Integrations with external government systems (e.g., actual business registration APIs).

required: Modern Saudi-business themed hero illustration with abstract city/office elements in green/white with subtle gold accents (sbl-hero.dim_1600x900.png)
